soc.message

Class SOCPickResources

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.message.SOCMessage
      • soc.message.SOCMessageForGame
        • soc.message.SOCPickResources
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class SOCPickResources
extends SOCMessageForGame
    This message says which resources the player picked for a Discovery/Year of Plenty card, or (v2.0.00+) free resources from the Gold Hex or other events in Sea Board scenarios.

    Also used in scenario SC_PIRI when player wins a free resource for defeating the pirate fleet attack at a dice roll, as if it's a gold hex free resource.

    Sent from Client:

    For Discovery/Year of Plenty, this is the client response to server's GAMESTATE(WAITING_FOR_DISCOVERY).

    For Gold Hex picks or other Sea Board scenarios, this is the Client response to server's SOCSimpleRequest(PROMPT_PICK_RESOURCES). (Same prompt/response pattern as SOCDiscardRequest / SOCDiscard.)

    In either of those situations, if the resource count is wrong, the server will resend SOCSimpleRequest(PROMPT_PICK_RESOURCES) with the required resource count.
    Otherwise, server announces a SOCPickResources to the game to give player those resources: See next section for details.

    Sent from Server:

    A player has chosen their two free Discovery/Year of Plenty resources in state GameState.WAITING_FOR_DISCOVERY, or free Gold Hex resources. Announced by server to update game data and have the client indicate that the trade has happened, as if they were sent a SOCGameServerText about it, based on getReasonCode() value. When reason code is 0, print no text: Server might follow this message with a SOCGameServerText to explain the reason for this resource pick.

    For gold hex picks, server follows this message with a SOCPlayerElement(NUM_PICK_GOLD_HEX_RESOURCES, 0) to clear that player field.

    When server announces to clients older than v2.4.50 (VERSION_FOR_SERVER_ANNOUNCE), it instead sends player data update SOCPlayerElement message(s) and SOCGameServerText.

    Before v2.0.00 this message class was called SOCDiscoveryPick.

    Author:
    Robert S. Thomas
    See Also:
    SOCPickResourceType, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SOCPickResources

        public SOCPickResources(java.lang.String gameName,
                        int cl,
                        int or,
                        int sh,
                        int wh,
                        int wo)
        Create a Pick Resources message without a player number or reason code.
        Parameters:
        gameName - the name of the game
        cl - the amount of clay being picked
        or - the amount of ore being picked
        sh - the amount of sheep being picked
        wh - the amount of wheat being picked
        wo - the amount of wood being picked
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • SOCPickResources

        public SOCPickResources(java.lang.String ga,
                        SOCResourceSet rs)
        Create a PickResources message without a player number or reason code.
        Parameters:
        ga - the name of the game
        rs - the resources being picked. Should not contain unknown resources, those will be ignored and not sent.

      • SOCPickResources

        public SOCPickResources(java.lang.String gameName,
                        SOCResourceSet rs,
                        int pn,
                        int rc)
        Create a PickResources message with an optional player number and reason code, for sending to client v2.4.50 or newer (VERSION_FOR_SERVER_ANNOUNCE).
        Parameters:
        gameName - the name of the game
        rs - the resources being picked. Should not contain unknown resources, those will be ignored and not sent.
        pn - player number when sent from server, or 0 when sent from client
        rc - reason code (REASON_DISCOVERY, etc), or 0 for none

        public int getPlayerNumber()
        Get the player number when sent from server, or 0 when sent from client.

        Returns:
        player number, or 0 if none
        Since:

        Ignored by clients older than VERSION_FOR_SERVER_ANNOUNCE.

        Returns:
        reason code, or 0 if none
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • stripAttribNames

        public static java.lang.String stripAttribNames(java.lang.String message)
        Strip out the parameter/attribute names from toString()'s format, returning message parameters as a comma-delimited list for SOCMessage.parseMsgStr(String).
        Parameters:
        message - Params part of a message string formatted by toString(); not null
        Returns:
        Message parameters without attribute names, or null if params are malformed
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: SOCMessage
        Simple human-readable delimited representation, used for debug purposes: SOCPutPiece:game=test5|playerNumber=3|pieceType=0|coord=40a
        Could also be used by a SOCServer.recordGameEvent(String, SOCMessage) implementation.

        Within this representation, message parameters should be in same order used by SOCMessage.toCmd() and parseDataStr(..). Should be parseable by SOCMessage.parseMsgStr(String) which calls SOCMessage.stripAttribNames(String), which your class can override if needed.

        Overrides:
        toString in class SOCMessageForGame
        Returns:
        a human readable form of the message
        See Also:
        SOCMessage.toCmd()
